001package net.tvburger.jdl.model;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.Array;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.*;
005
006import java.util.*;
007
008/**
009 * Represents a data set. A data set consist of samples. A sample has inputs (e.g. features or signals) and
010 * corresponding expected outputs.
011 *
012 * @param samples the samples to hold in this data set
013 */
014@DomainObject
015@Composition
016public record DataSet<N extends Number>(List<Sample<N>> samples) implements Iterable<DataSet.Sample<N>> {
017
018    /**
019     * Interface to load a data set.
020     */
021    @FactoryMethod
022    public interface Loader<N extends Number> {
023
024        /**
025         * The loaded data set.
026         *
027         * @return the loaded data set
028         */
029        DataSet<N> load();
030
031    }
032
033    /**
034     * The sample represents a single input for an estimation function and the corresponding expected outputs.
035     *
036     * @param features      the inputs for this sample
037     * @param targetOutputs the expected outputs for the given inputs
038     * @see EstimationFunction
039     */
040    @DomainObject
041    @ValueObject
042    public record Sample<N extends Number>(Array<N> features, Array<N> targetOutputs) {
043
044        /**
045         * Utility method to create a sample
046         *
047         * @param feature      the inputs for the sample
048         * @param targetOutput the expected outputs for the sample
049         * @return the sample
050         */
051        @StaticFactory
052        public static <N extends Number> DataSet.Sample<N> of(Array<N> feature, Array<N> targetOutput) {
053            return new DataSet.Sample<>(feature, targetOutput);
054        }
055
056        /**
057         * Returns the number of features in this sample.
058         * <p>
059         * The feature count corresponds to the dimensionality of the
060         * input vector (the <b>arity</b> of the function being trained or
061         * estimated). This is typically the number of independent variables
062         * or input attributes provided by the dataset.
063         * </p>
064         *
065         * @return the number of input features in this sample
066         */
067        public int featureCount() {
068            return features.length();
069        }
070
071        /**
072         * Returns the number of target outputs in this sample.
073         * <p>
074         * The target count corresponds to the dimensionality of the
075         * expected output vector (the <b>co-arity</b> of the function being
076         * trained or estimated). This is typically the number of dependent
077         * variables, labels, or regression targets provided by the dataset.
078         * </p>
079         *
080         * @return the number of target outputs in this sample
081         */
082        public int targetCount() {
083            return targetOutputs.length();
084        }
085
086        /**
087         * Checks whether this sample is compatible with the given estimation function.
088         * <p>
089         * A dataset is considered compatible if:
090         * <ul>
091         *   <li>its feature count equals the function's {@code arity()}, and</li>
092         *   <li>its target count equals the function's {@code coArity()}.</li>
093         * </ul>
094         *
095         * @param estimationFunction the estimation function to compare against
096         * @return {@code true} if the dataset matches the function's input/output schema;
097         * {@code false} otherwise
098         */
099        public boolean isCompatibleWith(EstimationFunction<N> estimationFunction) {
100            return estimationFunction.arity() == featureCount() && estimationFunction.coArity() == targetCount();
101        }
102
103        /**
104         * {@inheritDoc}
105         */
106        @Override
107        public boolean equals(Object o) {
108            if (this == o) return true;
109            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
110            Sample<?> sample = (Sample<?>) o;
111            return Array.equals(features, sample.features) && Array.equals(targetOutputs, sample.targetOutputs);
112        }
113
114        /**
115         * {@inheritDoc}
116         */
117        @Override
118        public int hashCode() {
119            int result = Array.hashCode(features);
120            result = 31 * result + Array.hashCode(targetOutputs);
121            return result;
122        }
123
124        /**
125         * {@inheritDoc}
126         */
127        @Override
128        public String toString() {
129            return "Sample{" +
130                    "features=" + Array.toString(features) +
131                    ", targetOutputs=" + Array.toString(targetOutputs) +
132                    '}';
133        }
134
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Create a new data set for the given samples, where samples can't added or removed.
139     *
140     * @param sample the samples to put in the data set
141     * @return the data set
142     */
143    @SafeVarargs
144    @StaticFactory
145    public static <N extends Number> DataSet<N> of(Sample<N>... sample) {
146        if (sample.length > 0) {
147            Sample<N> firstSample = sample[0];
148            for (int i = 1; i < sample.length; i++) {
149                if (firstSample.featureCount() != sample[i].featureCount()
150                        || firstSample.targetCount() != sample[i].targetCount()) {
151                    throw new IllegalArgumentException("Sample " + i + " has wrong size!");
152                }
153            }
154        }
155        return new DataSet<>(List.of(sample));
156    }
157
158    /**
159     * Creates a new empty data set
160     */
161    @StaticFactory
162    public static <N extends Number> DataSet<N> create() {
163        return new DataSet<>(new ArrayList<>());
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Creates a new data set that contains only a subset of samples. Useful for cutting a single data set into
168     * a training, validation, and test set.
169     *
170     * @param fromIndex the fromIndex inclusive
171     * @param toIndex   the toIndex exclusive
172     * @return the new data set containing only a subset of the samples
173     * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the indexes are not properly given
174     */
175    public DataSet<N> subset(int fromIndex, int toIndex) {
176        return new DataSet<>(samples.subList(fromIndex, toIndex));
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Adds the given sample to the data set
181     *
182     * @param sample the sample to add
183     */
184    public void addSample(Sample<N> sample) {
185        if (!samples.isEmpty()) {
186            if (sample.featureCount() != samples.getFirst().featureCount()
187                    || sample.targetCount() != samples.getFirst().targetCount()) {
188                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Sample has wrong size!");
189            }
190        }
191        samples.add(sample);
192    }
193
194    /**
195     * Adds the given sample to the data set
196     *
197     * @param features      the inputs for the sample
198     * @param targetOutputs the expected outputs for the sample
199     */
200    public void addSample(Array<N> features, Array<N> targetOutputs) {
201        addSample(Sample.of(features, targetOutputs));
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Removes the first occurrence of the sample of the data set. No-op if not present.
206     *
207     * @param sample the sample to remove
208     */
209    public void removeSample(Sample<N> sample) {
210        samples.remove(sample);
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Returns the number of features in this data set.
215     * <p>
216     * The feature count corresponds to the dimensionality of the
217     * input vector (the <b>arity</b> of the function being trained or
218     * estimated). This is typically the number of independent variables
219     * or input attributes provided by the dataset.
220     * </p>
221     *
222     * @return the number of input features in this sample
223     */
224    public int getFeatureCount() {
225        if (samples.isEmpty()) {
226            throw new IllegalStateException("No samples!");
227        }
228        return samples.getFirst().featureCount();
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * Returns the number of target outputs in this data set.
233     * <p>
234     * The target count corresponds to the dimensionality of the
235     * expected output vector (the <b>co-arity</b> of the function being
236     * trained or estimated). This is typically the number of dependent
237     * variables, labels, or regression targets provided by the dataset.
238     * </p>
239     *
240     * @return the number of target outputs in this sample
241     */
242    public int getTargetCount() {
243        if (samples.isEmpty()) {
244            throw new IllegalStateException("No samples!");
245        }
246        return samples.getFirst().targetCount();
247    }
248
249    /**
250     * {@inheritDoc}
251     */
252    @Override
253    public Iterator<Sample<N>> iterator() {
254        return samples().listIterator();
255    }
256
257    /**
258     * Checks whether this dataset is compatible with the given estimation function.
259     * <p>
260     * A dataset is considered compatible if:
261     * <ul>
262     *   <li>its feature count per sample equals the function's {@code arity()}, and</li>
263     *   <li>its target count per sample equals the function's {@code coArity()}.</li>
264     * </ul>
265     *
266     * @param estimationFunction the estimation function to compare against
267     * @return {@code true} if the dataset matches the function's input/output schema;
268     * {@code false} otherwise
269     */
270    public boolean isCompatibleWith(EstimationFunction<N> estimationFunction) {
271        return samples.isEmpty() || samples.getFirst().isCompatibleWith(estimationFunction);
272    }
273
274    /**
275     * Ensures that this {@link DataSet} is compatible with the given
276     * {@link EstimationFunction}.
277     *
278     * <p>
279     * Compatibility typically means that the structure of the dataset
280     * (e.g., feature dimensionality, output dimensionality) matches
281     * the requirements of the estimation function. This method is a
282     * guard to prevent training or evaluation with mismatched models
283     * and datasets.
284     * </p>
285     *
286     * <p>
287     * If the dataset is compatible, this method returns the current
288     * instance for fluent chaining. If it is not compatible, an
289     * {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown.
290     * </p>
291     *
292     * @param estimationFunction the estimation function to check against
293     * @return this dataset, if compatible
294     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the dataset is not compatible
295     *                                  with the given estimation function
296     */
297    public DataSet<N> compatible(EstimationFunction<N> estimationFunction) {
298        if (!isCompatibleWith(estimationFunction)) {
299            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Incompatible estimation function!");
300        }
301        return this;
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Returns the number of samples in the data set.
306     *
307     * @return the number of samples in the data set
308     */
309    public int size() {
310        return samples.size();
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Returns true if there are no samples in the data set
315     *
316     * @return true if empty
317     */
318    public boolean isEmpty() {
319        return samples.isEmpty();
320    }
321
322    public DataSet<N> resample(int n) {
323        return resample(n, new Random());
324    }
325
326    public DataSet<N> resample(int n, Random random) {
327        List<Sample<N>> resampled = new ArrayList<>();
328        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
329            resampled.add(samples.get(random.nextInt(0, samples.size())));
330
331        }
332        return new DataSet<>(resampled);
333    }
334}
